paragraphs: Andrea Conangla (*1993 in Tarragona, Spain) grew up in Portugal and at the age of 12 began to learn violin, trumpet and later singing. Before moving to Stuttgart in 2017 to study contemporary music with Prof. Angelika Luz at the Hochschule for Music und darstellende Kunst Stuttgart, Andrea Conangla studied in Portugal (Universidade de Aveiro) and in the Netherlands (Prins Claus Conservatorium). During her Education Masters Degree, Andrea Conangla developed a creative approach to the teaching of voice to actors through movement and improvisation which lead her to work with diverse groups of people.

From 2013 to 2015 she successfully participated in international competitions in Portugal. Andrea Conangla is the winner of the Santa Cecília International Music Competition, in Porto (1st prize) and the International Music Competition “Cidade do Fundão” (2nd prize).

She is internationally active as a soloist and chamber music partner in the field of classical and new music. Andrea Conangla took part in important programs for young artists, for example in the Tenso Europe Chamber Choir and in the Académie Voix Nouvelles in France. She has sung in several museums in Stuttgart, with repertoire from John Cage to Bernhard Lang and performed numerous world premieres. In addition to her work as a singer, she is interested in the multidisciplinary aspect of art. An important part of her studies at the HMDK Stuttgart was also studying composition as a minor with Martin Schüttler, which opened up a new perspective on conceptual music, activism and performance.

During the 2020/21 season, Andrea Conangla has the pleasure of integrating the SWR Vokalensemble as Praktikantin. She is also Docent for Vocal Improvisation at the Staatliche Hochschule für Musik Trossingen.
